before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ac727","text":"A. Pre-cool centrifuge, buffers, and consumables with sample contact (e.g., gentleMACS C Tube and Strainers) at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v9ru","text":"B. Per extraction, add 0.2U/ul RNase inhibitor to one 1.6 ml aliquot of Miltenyi Nuclei Extraction Buffer (8µl of 40U/uL RNase inhibitor) and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":107,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avqlr","text":"C. Per extraction, add 1 mM DTT to one 750 µl aliquot of Sucrose Solution (0.58µl 1.3M DTT) in a 2 ml tube and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":50},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":75,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s99p","text":"D. Per extraction, prepare 750ul Nuclei Suspension Buffer per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"355os","text":"This SOP aims to extract nuclei from unfixed snap-frozen mouse prefrontal cortex, hippocampus, and Striatum tissues (~3-15mg). It was optimized and tested on mice ranging in age groups from 3, 6, 14, and 15-month-old mice on different diets, including high-fat (45%) and regular chow (6%). Other differences included sex, strain, and genotype. These preps resulted in a minimum of debris for downstream snRNAseq HT assays on the 10X Genomics chromium X controller (HT, High Throughput chips). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fn3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5ffa","text":"This protocol was also used to perform snRNAseq assays from human glioblastoma snap frozen tissues. Follow BSL-2 guidelines when working with human tissues.  These preps resulted in a minimum of debris for downstream snRNAseq ST assays on the 10X Genomics chromium X controller (ST, Standard Throughput chips). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mbmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hbe4","text":"This protocol enables to process up to 8 samples simultaneously. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dl27","text":"This protocol has only been tested on a limited number of tissues which includes human and mouse brain frozen tissue. Before using this protocol in production on your tissue of interest, run a pilot experiment to determine optimal dissociation of your tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9r51o","text":"A. Use wide-bore pipette tips to avoid damage when handling tissue or nuclei, and pipette slowly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79dab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk6d6","text":"B. Keep tissue on dry ice until ready to start gentleMACS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92a2p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfti6","text":"C. Miltenyi gentleMACS Recommendations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fh8m","text":"Tissue 1-4 mg - 4C_nuclei_1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd6ao","text":"Tissue 5-7 mg - cus_4C_nuclei_5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4v6u8","text":"Tissue 7-15 mg - cus_4C_nuclei_10 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eafp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26dml","text":"The \"cus\" protocols are custom SOP from Miltenyi. It adds 5 or 10 minutes of mixing at 20 RPM after the Miltenyi 5-minute disassociation SOP 4C_nuclei. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mjt7","text":"    * Optimization may be needed depending on tissue type, size, and condition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeip4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft2p6","text":"D. \"To sucrose\" or \"not to sucrose\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l7eu","text":"If initial sample size is \u003c 5 mg, it is recommended to wash nuclei without using a sucrose gradient (Step 3).  If initial sample size is \u003e 5 mg, it is recommended to purify nuclei using a sucrose gradient (Step 2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3miuf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l1s1","text":"E. Sucrose column recommendations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed8po","text":"After the sucrose cleanup, a tissue less than 3-5 mg may have a very low nuclei yield. It is recommended to test this first on a representative sample to ensure precious samples are not lost. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpjbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v74q","text":"Hoechst/Syto RNA Select Staining Guidelines","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vjmf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jea3","text":"1. Extracellular debris should be minimal after the nuclei have been passed through the sucrose column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u4lv","text":"2. Extracellular debris will be present in a much greater quantity if a sucrose column is not used. Debris can interfere with downstream 10x operations by introducing clogs and background ambient RNA.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9595r","text":"3. Nuclei should be intact, with minimal blebbing and clumping. Blebbing of nuclei will make them more prone to clumping, which can introduce clogs when loading the 10x chip. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7js65","text":"4. The Hoechst and Syto Select staining should be uniform through the nuclei, but the Syto staining usually has more variation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aekg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3frpd","text":"If working with human tissue, follow all institutional rules and guidelines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
